Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Dish
Description: Flat dish with a very simple shape. The base is rounded and bears cutting traces, the body is flared and the lip is an extension of the body. Made from a white calcareous clay, the vessel was a product of Upper Egypt. A potter's mark, a six branched cross, was carved below the lip before firing.
